comment:
Taste the alcohol but nice spice and chocolate flavor. Smelling it is like whiffing turpentine. Who needs a nose hair trimmer when you can singe them away with this thing. They like it hot in Waco bro.

Note : check out their single malt and bourbon

Complex all around

Nose:
New wood floor or carpet showroom smell
Slight Maple and oak

Front: 
Toasted Oak maple and espresso coffee nutty

Back/Finish:
The espresso keeps going and at the end lingers. Also at the end Chocolate Carmel Weathers candy and nutty
Vanilla, apples, chocolate and spice without any of the normal dill/licorice typically found in ryes. Great neat and over ice on a warm day.
Remember when I said balcones rye was spicy? Yeah but cask strength spicy 👌🏻
Another winner from Balcones!  Chocolate, Carmel, with citrus and dandelion at the forefront.
Tasty notes of spice and vanilla.

The nose contains dust, faint rye spice, and a little bit of barrel, but is not particularly interesting or distinct. The taste kicks off with intense dark chocolate unfolding into something like a charred burger Patty. Which sounds gross, but is really engaging.
